answer:
Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis:
• Frame 1: At the overhead signal, there’s a small sign stating “Left Turn Yield on Flashing Yellow Arrow.” However, far more prominent in this frame is a large orange, diamond‐shaped sign on the right reading “Be Prepared to Stop.”  
• Frame 2: The orange “Be Prepared to Stop” sign fills the foreground, and you can see another similar sign just beyond it.  
• Frame 3: Although the camera has moved forward, that same (or a second) “Be Prepared to Stop” sign remains visible on the right as you proceed.  
• Frame 4: Yet again, an orange sign with “Be Prepared to Stop” is visible in the right‐hand lane’s view.  
• Frame 5: We see at least one, possibly two, more of these orange “Be Prepared to Stop” signs beyond the truck.

Contextual Reasoning:  
While there is one overhead sign about yielding on a flashing arrow, the multiple, large, orange, diamond‐shaped signs repeating “Be Prepared to Stop” dominate. This is clearly the message repeated most frequently along the road, suggesting upcoming conditions (perhaps construction or merging) that require motorists to be ready to halt.

Match to Answer Choices:  
• A. Yield – Only appears in a single smaller sign regarding the flashing yellow arrow.  
• B. Stop – The signs do not read “Stop” outright; they instruct preparedness.  
• C. No right turn on red – No sign states this.  
• D. Be prepared to stop – Matches exactly what is printed on the multiple large, orange signs.

<answer>D. Be prepared to stop</answer>
